sen.j: 清寧天皇（せいねいてんのう、允恭天皇33年（444年）？ - 清寧天皇5年1月16日 (旧暦)（484年2月27日））は、第22代の天皇（在位：清寧天皇元年1月15日 (旧暦)（480年2月11日） - 同5年1月16日（484年2月27日））。
sen.e: Emperor Seinei (c. 444 - February 27, 484), whose reign was from February 11, 480 to February 27, 484, was the 22nd Emperor.
Emperor Seinei (c. 444 - February 27, 484), who reigned from February 11, 480, to February 27, 484, was the twenty-second Emperor of Japan.

sen.e: His Wafu-shigo (Japanese-style posthumous name) was Shiraka no Takehirokuni oshiwaka yamato neko no Sumeramikoto, alternatively Shiraga oyamato neko no Mikoto, according to Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters).

His Japanese-style posthumous name was Shiraka no Takehirokuni oshiwaka yamato neko no Sumeramikoto (emperor), and alternatively, Shiraga oyamato neko no Mikoto, according to "Kojiki" (literally, The Records of Ancient Matters).

sen.j: 吉備氏の母を持つ星川皇子が大蔵を占拠し、権勢を縦にしたため、大伴室屋・東漢直掬らにこれを焼き殺させる。
sen.e: Hoshikawa no Miko, whose mother was from the Kibi clan, occupied Okura (imperial storehouse) wielding his power; Emperor Seinei ordered OTOMO no Muroya and YAMATONOAYA no Ataitsuka to burn Hoshikawa no Miko to death.

Since Hoshikawa no Miko, whose mother was from the Kibi clan, occupied Okura (imperial storehouse) while hiding behind his powerful maternal family, the Emperor Seinei ordered OTOMO no Muroya and YAMATONOAYA no Ataitsuka to burn Hoshikawa no Miko to death.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正しました。原文「縦」は「盾」の誤りだと思われます。
sen.e: Since Hoshikawa no Miko, whose mother was from the Kibi clan, occupied Okura (imperial storehouse) while hiding behind his powerful maternal family, the Emperor Seinei ordered OTOMO no Muroya and YAMATONOAYA no Ataitsuka to burn Hoshikawa no Miko to death.

sen.j: だが、清寧天皇2年（481年）、市辺押磐皇子の子である億計王（後の仁賢天皇）・弘計王（後の顕宗天皇）の兄弟を播磨で発見したとの情報を得、使者を立てて明石に迎えさせる。
sen.e: However, in 481, he obtained information that Oke no Mikoto (億計王, subsequent Emperor Ninken) and his brother Oke no Mikoto (弘計王, subsequent Emperor Kenzo), both was the sons of Ichinobe no Oshiha no Miko, were discovered in Harima, so he called them sending an envoy to Akashi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in 481, he obtained information that Oke no Mikoto (which was written as "億計王" in Japanese, who was the future Emperor Ninken) and his younger brother Oke no Mikoto (which was written as "弘計王" in Japanese, who was the future Emperor Kenzo), who were both sons of Ichinohe (or Ichinobe) no Oshiha no Miko, were discovered in Harima, thereby sending an envoy to Akashi to fetch them.
sen.cmt: 形式・用語・表現上の修正を加えました
sen.e: However, in 481, he obtained information that Oke no Mikoto (which was written as "億計王" in Japanese, who was the future Emperor Ninken) and his younger brother Oke no Mikoto (which was written as "弘計王" in Japanese, who was the future Emperor Kenzo), who were both sons of Ichinohe (or Ichinobe) no Oshiha no Miko, were discovered in Harima, thereby sending an envoy to Akashi to fetch them.

sen.j: 翌年（482年）2王を宮中に迎え入れ、億計王を立太子に、弘計王を皇子とした。
sen.e: In 482, Emperor Seinei welcomed the brothers into the imperial court to settle Oke no Mikoto (億計王) as a crown prince, and Oke no Mikoto (弘計王) as an imperial prince, respectively.
sen.cmt: 本来の「立太子」の意味からすると意味が通りません；「立太子」→「皇太子」と解釈しました。
sen.e: In 482, Emperor Seinei welcomed the two brothers into the imperial court and designated the older Oke no Mikoto ("億計王") as Crown Prince and the younger Oke no Mikoto ("弘計王") as an imperial prince, respectively.
sen.cmt: 形式・表現上の修正を加えました
sen.e: In 482, Emperor Seinei welcomed the two brothers into the imperial court and designated the older Oke no Mikoto ("億計王") as Crown Prince and the younger Oke no Mikoto ("弘計王") as an imperial prince, respectively.
